CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 15, 1955, pg. 11 reads: "Cutting Cake - Mrs. Maude Peays and the Rev. Charles W. Stanley exchange marriage vows, 7:30 P.M., Oct. 1, at the bride's residence, 2562 Centre Avenue, with the Rev. W.B. Gray Jr. officiating. The bride wore a pale pink bolero sheath with rhinestone interest.  Her attendant, Mrs. Mary Neville Smith, chose a similar style in powder blue.  James E .Smith was best man.  Mrs. Lillie Bell Peays, Mrs. Eddie Stanley and Mrs. Lillie F. Thompson had charge of the reception which followed the ceremony."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of wedding party with three women and three men, including groom Rev. Charles W. Stanley wearing dinner jacket, and bride Maude Peays Stanley wearing light colored belted dress and short sleeved jacket, posed behind three tiered wedding cake in bride's home, 2562 Centre Avenue, another version
